William Brink and Louis Har-
ris are authors of the volume
published last month by Simon and
Schuster. The book Is based pri-
marily upon study made last
Summer by Louis Harris and
Associates, famed for their pub
lie opinion polls and analyses.

zine articles originally published

The survey revealed that Negro
citizens rate the NAACP as the
top civil rights organization in
the country.

Junior high school and high
schoolers are invited to attend
free tap dancing classes at East
lake Park center starting April
6 at 7 pm. Instructor will be
Mr.. Budd.


Earl Turner will instruct box.
ing starting April E at S pm.
Boys in grade 5-l2 are eligible.

ing baseball and softball teams.

LONDON : The British Safety
Council is urging Industrial
workers who adopt the Beatles'
shaggy hair style to wear hair
nets at work. The council has
put up $4,000 posters in factory
locker rooms showing boy who
lost his Beatle cut in a machine.

WASHINGTON The Pentagon
civil rights chief said Tuesday
there are only 81 Negro cadets
among the 1000 men at the Army.
Navy and Air Force academies
because "lots of Negro young
sters just don't dream they have
a chance"

Sammy Davis, Jr., regarded
as one of the worlds great per-
fromers, returned to the Sands

CHICACO-The family Of Ralph
Bush, a Negro, who died after
his arrest by city policemen in
Oct. 1862, received an out OF
court settlement of $4,000.


Bush's family filed suit
against six Chicago policemen
and the City of Chicago for
100000 alleging brutal beatings
caused his death.


The victim arrested on COM
plant of a drug store manager
who reported the disappearance
of a bottle of whiskey. Bush and
a companion we're identified as
having been In the store at the
time.


Bush was admitted to Cook
County Hospital with a head
wound. He died shortly afterward.

try is bombarded with 100000
pounds of rain and snow year.
